contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese city |Name = Ibaraki |JapaneseName = 茨城町 |settlement_type = Town |MapImage = Ibaraki in Ibaraki Prefecture Ja.svg |Prefecture = [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]] |District = [[Higashiibaraki District, Ibaraki|Higashiibaraki]] |Region = [[Kantō region|Kantō]] |Area_km2 = 121.64 |Population = 34,964 |PopDate = 2003 |Density_km2 = auto |Coords = |LatitudeDegrees = 36 |LatitudeMinutes = 17 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 140 |LongtitudeMinutes = 25 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Postal code = |Area code = |Mayor = |Tree = |Flower = |Bird = |SymbolImage = |SymbolDescription = |CityHallPostalCode = |CityHallAddress = |CityHallPhone = |CityHallLink = [http://www.town.ibaraki.lg.jp/ Town of Ibaraki] |CityMap = |Elevation = }} {{nihongo|'''Ibaraki'''|茨城町|Ibaraki-machi}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Higashiibaraki District, Ibaraki|Higashiibaraki District]], [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. The town was set to merge with [[Mito, Ibaraki|Mito]], [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]] on December 8, 2007, but following the election of a new mayor in April 2007, these plans were abandoned. As of 2003, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 34,964 and a [[population density|density]] of 287.44 persons per km². The total area is 121.64 km². ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} * [http://www.town.ibaraki.lg.jp/ Ibaraki official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Towns in Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
